Question 77) The presumption that the surface of the plateau and plateaues represents an old peplanicity is corroborated by the fact that it is covered by superficial accumulations, such as sand masses, shells of gravel and pebbles and the widespread occurrence of rusting concretions that form A lateritic crust, called “yoke”.
What climate type favors the soil change process described in the text?
A) arid with water deficit.
B) subtropical, with low temperatures.
C) seasoned, with cold and dry winters.
D) tropical, with the seasonality of the rains.
E) equatorial, with abundant rainfall.
